(['Jupyter and the future of IPython', 'Announcements', 'Citing IPython'], ['IPython provides a rich architecture for interactive computing with:', 'To get started with IPython in the Jupyter Notebook, see our ', '.  Our ', ' is an excellent way to see the many
things you can do with IPython while learning about a variety of topics, from
basic programming to advanced statistics or quantum mechanics.', 'To learn more about IPython, you can download our ', ', or read
our ', '.  IPython is open source
(BSD license), and is used by a range of ', '; add your project to that
list if it uses IPython as a library, and please don’t forget to ', '.', 'IPython supports Python 2.7 and 3.3 or newer. Our older 1.x series supports
Python 2.6 and 3.2.', 'IPython is a growing project, with increasingly language-agnostic components.
IPython 3.x was the last monolithic release of IPython,
containing the notebook server, qtconsole, etc.
As of IPython 4.0, the language-agnostic parts of the project:
the notebook format, message protocol, qtconsole, notebook web application, etc.
have moved to new projects under the name ', '.
IPython itself is focused on interactive Python,
part of which is providing a Python kernel for Jupyter.', 'IPython tends to be released on the last Friday of each month, this section updated rarely. Please have a look at the release history on ', '.', 'Several of the authors of IPython are connected with academic and scientific
research, so it is important for us to be able to show the impact of our work
in other projects and fields.', 'If IPython contributes to a project that leads to a scientific publication,
please acknowledge this fact by citing the project. You can use this
', '.', 'A powerful interactive shell.', 'A kernel for ', '.', 'Support for interactive data visualization and use of ', '.', 'Flexible, ', ' interpreters to load into your own projects.', 'Easy to use, high performance tools for ', '.', ': Released on Jan 31st 2020.', ': Released on Dec 27, 2019 and Jan 1st 2020', ': Released on Nov 27, 2019 and Dec 1st 2019', ': Released on Oct 25, 2019', ': Released on Aug 30, 2019', ': Released on Jul 26, 2019', ': Released on June 28th, and July 3rd 2019.', ': fixes to issues brought by 7.4, documentation changes and other minor updates (April 25, 2019)', ': improvements to the completion system and miscellaneous fixes (March 21, 2019)', ': several bugfixes, minor improvements and Python 3.8 support (February 18, 2019)', ': minor bugfixes, improvements, and new configuration options
(November 29, 2018)', ': fixes to new features, internal refactoring,
and fixes for regressions (October 27, 2018)', ': major new features (September 27th, 2018).

for more information about what’s new.', ': minor bugfixes and Python 3.7 compatibility (July 28, 2018)', ': minor bugfixes (July 28, 2018)', ' and ', ': minor bugfixes (May 10, 2018)', ' and ', ': new features and bugfixes
(April 2, 2018)', ': This release, the first to require Python 3, integrates the

in New York City on August 23-25 2017, along with a satellite training
